content: Roy has Geographic Engineering degree at UNMSM and a master’s degree in Computer Science at PUCP. He has contributed significantly to research initiatives focused on spatial data science such as Rgee and CloudSen12. Currently is working as a geoinformatics researcher in the TIDOP research group of USAL (Spain) participating in national and European projects (LAW-GAME, TREEADS, CHAMELEON) in the field of photogrammetry (NeRF, Gaussian Splatting), remote sensing and artificial intelligence.
summary: Roy has Geographic Engineering degree at UNMSM and a master’s degree in Computer Science at PUCP. He has contributed significantly to research initiatives focused on spatial data science such as Rgee and CloudSen12.
title: Ryali93!

content:
What I do  I have been programming code for more than a decade, and I am still learning and dedicating myself to it, mainly in the field of geoinformatics. I am a geographer by profession, but I have a master’s degree in computer science, as well as a background in different fields of engineering.
My skills are focused on GIS development, spatial data analysis and research, which is my passion. Specifically, I am interested in Geographic Information Systems (GIS), remote sensing and artificial intelligence (AI). I master analysis in different languages such as Python or R, and specifically Earth Observation (EO) and deep learning technologies (Tensorflow, Pytorch, Wandb, Github, etc.).
My experience has led me to participate in local and international projects, allowing me to work in interdisciplinary, multicultural and multilingual groups. In recent years, my taste for academia led me to teach courses and/or workshops at the university and to participate in research projects. From here I highlight RGEE, Cloudsen12 and others on the application of different methods of analysis for spatial analysis.
Finally, the years have helped me to master project management methodologies (traditional and agile) and to manage the software lifecycle properly, establishing workflows to achieve the objectives of the commissioned projects.
 How I got here  My journey began with my undergraduate studies in Peru, where I spent several years working across various sectors, tackling challenges related to spatial data management. This experience sparked my interest in programming languages, starting with R, progressing through Python and JavaScript, to C++. Before I knew it, this path led me to pursue a master’s degree in computer science. The wealth of experience I gained not only boosted my confidence but also equipped me to independently manage comprehensive projects and contribute to research initiatives. Following two years of pandemic-induced isolation and in pursuit of international opportunities, the University of Salamanca came into the picture, offering me a sponsorship that enabled me to venture overseas. This academic transition was significant, marking one of the most profound and growth-filled phases of my life. Despite missing my family and friends back home, the joy of engaging in work I’m passionate about is immensely fulfilling.
 Where I am  Currently, I reside in vila, Spain, balancing my time between work and my PhD studies at the University of Salamanca. During holidays, I seize the opportunity to return to Peru, where my parents and siblings live, providing a perfect escape from the (for me) extreme weather conditions here in Spain.
 My free time  In my leisure moments, I enjoy diving into different programming languages and exploring various frameworks. Cycling and wandering through the fields offer me a refreshing break from my routine. In the urban landscape, I take pleasure in meandering from one corner of the city to another, strolling alongside the river, and exploring quaint towns. Another passion of mine is designing and creating 3D models with my Prusa MK4. These hobbies provide a creative outlet and a chance to unwind from my academic and professional pursuits.
summary: What I do  I have been programming code for more than a decade, and I am still learning and dedicating myself to it, mainly in the field of geoinformatics.

Los avances en ingenier铆a han permitido la creaci贸n de presas de gran magnitud. Sin embargo, un tema poco visto en el dise帽o de presas es la estimaci贸n de su tiempo de vida por acumulaci贸n de sedimentos. En esta investigaci贸n se utiliza un modelo emp铆rico con herramientas satelitales de acceso libre que permitan estimar el volumen muerto a trav茅s de los a帽os y estimar su tiempo de vida 煤til. El modelo de erosi贸n RUSLE y el coeficiente de producci贸n de sedimentos (SDR) ya han sido utilizados con resultados satisfactorios en cuencas de distintas partes del mundo, en esta investigaci贸n se ha validado a partir del volumen de sedimentos del reservorio Gallito Ciego.

El objetivo general del proyecto de Censos Nacionales (CPV2017) es contar con informaci贸n actualizada de las actividades realizadas en los procesos de Segmentaci贸n. Como parte de este proceso, la primera parte corresponde a una actualizaci贸n cartogr谩fica y registro de viviendas y establecimientos, para lo cual se requiere lo siguiente:
 Disponer de una base de datos espacial para la segmentaci贸n Contar con el mapa actualizado de cada uno de los distritos del pa铆s Contar con el plano actualizado de cada uno de los centros poblados urbanos del pa铆s. Disponer de un directorio de viviendas urbanas y rurales  El siguiente paso viene a ser la segmentaci贸n, para lo cual se ha dividido en diferentes procesos:
 Elaborar de forma automatizada las 谩reas de empadronamiento urbano y rural (croquis y listados) que se asignar谩 a los/las empadronadores/as como carga de trabajo en el d铆a del Censo. Estimar el n煤mero de c茅dulas y documentos necesarios para el empadronamiento nacional. Conformar las secciones censales y determinar la cantidad de jefes/as de secci贸n necesaria para el empadronamiento. Estimar el n煤mero de funcionarios censales: Jefes/as de zona, jefes/as de secci贸n y empadronadores/as.  Recopilaci贸n de data en campo Consistenciar BD Consistencia espacial Consistencia de datos Consistencia Pruebas de calidad  Desarrollo de la segmentaci贸n:
 Carga de base de datos Pruebas de calidad Pre Segmentaci贸n Segmentaci贸n urbana Segmentaci贸n rural  Principalmente, para el desarrollo de la segmentaci贸n rural, se realiz贸 lo siguiente:
 Formaci贸n de las 谩reas de empadronamiento rural (AER) Formaci贸n de las secciones censales rurales (SCR) Generaci贸n de listados de la segmentaci贸n rural  Listado de viviendas del 谩rea de empadronamiento rural Listado de 谩reas de empadronamiento de la secci贸n censal rural Listado de 谩reas de empadronamiento del distrito.   Elaboraci贸n y generaci贸n del croquis para la segmentaci贸n rural  Croquis del 谩rea de empadronamiento rural Croquis de la secci贸n censal rural Impresi贸n simult谩nea de los listados y croquis rurales   Desarrollo del sistema integrado de la segmentaci贸n  M贸dulo de segmentaci贸n M贸dulo de croquis y listados M贸dulo de control de calidad M贸dulo de impresi贸n M贸dulo de legajos M贸dulo de reportes   Pruebas de calidad de segmentaci贸n     ryali93/SegmRural   C贸digos de desarrollo para la segmentaci贸n rural (repartici贸n de carga laboral por empadronador), que comprende la automatizaci贸n de mapas y reportes que se lleven a campo. El presente producto servir谩 de insumo para la planificaci贸n de los recursos h铆dricos y ser谩 una herramienta en el marco del programa de presas. Los temas revisados son los siguientes:
 Modelo de la erosi贸n de suelos mediantes la Ecuaci贸n Universal de P茅rdida de suelos Revisado (RUSLE) y Sistema de Informaci贸n Geogr谩fica (SIG) Estimaci贸n de la producci贸n de sedimentos en embalses con el Ratio de Aporte de Sedimentos (SDR) Estimar el volumen de sedimentos acumulados en las propuestas de embalses a partir de una relaci贸n con los sedimentos y d) la elaboraci贸n de un aplicativo con interfaz gr谩fica en el lenguaje de programaci贸n R para evaluar la carga de sedimentos y para los fines que solicita la Autoridad Nacional del Agua.

content:
This is the advanced tag. Just like other listing pages in Blowfish, you can add custom content to individual taxonomy terms and it will be displayed at the top of the term listing. 
You can also use these content pages to define Hugo metadata like titles and descriptions that will be used for SEO and other purposes.
summary: This is the advanced tag. Just like other listing pages in Blowfish, you can add custom content to individual taxonomy terms and it will be displayed at the top of the term listing.
title: Advanced

content:
Blowfish has full support for Hugo taxonomies and will adapt to any taxonomy set up. Taxonomy listings like this one also support custom content to be displayed above the list of terms.
This area could be used to add some extra decriptive text to each taxonomy. Check out the advanced tag below to see how to take this concept even further.
summary: Blowfish has full support for Hugo taxonomies and will adapt to any taxonomy set up. Taxonomy listings like this one also support custom content to be displayed above the list of terms.
